#Text=Rotterdam-The Hague Metropolitan Region
#Text=Rotterdam-The Hague Metropolitan Region
#Text=( Metropoolregio Rotterdam Den Haag or MRDH in Dutch ) is the large metropolitan area around the cities Rotterdam and The Hague ( Den Haag in Dutch ) .
#Text=It is also a big part of the Southern Randstad ( with other big cities like Amsterdam and Utrecht )

#Text=MRDH was first recognised officially on January 1 , 2015 , with the merging of the areas Haaglanden ( Greater Hague ) and Stadsregio Rotterdam ( Rotterdam Urban Area , more common name Rijnmond , literally " Rhine Estuary " )

column1: #Text=This is where all the big waterways flow into the North Sea , which is also the location of one of the biggest sea ports of the world .
#Text=The Hague is the seat of the Dutch parliament and government , and the future residence of King Willem-Alexander ( the Royal Family lives also in the MRDH , but in Wassenaar ) .
#Text=Besides Rotterdam and The Hague , Delft is a very popular city for tourists .
#Text=Tourist can discover lots of other interesting places as it comes to culture , nature and recreation .
#Text=Take the beaches and the dunes which are worthwhile a visit all the year round or discover the beauty of the typical Holland town Schiedam .
#Text=Municipalities
#Text=— a large economic center with modern architecture .
#Text=The sea port with impressive large areas like Europoort and the Maasvlakte also belong to Rotterdam .
#Text=— Binnenhof , palaces , embassies and several international institutions .
#Text=Also Scheveningen , the largest beach resort of the country , forms part of The Hague
#Text=— Delftware pottery and a historic town center
#Text=– Seaport and beach resort by the North Sea ( part of Rotterdam )
#Text=- typical municipality for the region with two little historic centers
#Text=- an open and wide rural area with picturesque villages in between The Hague , Delft , Rotterdam and Europoort
#Text=— a rapidly urbanized town near The Hague
#Text=— the historic town famous for its jenever and the tallest historic windmills in the world
#Text=— dunes along the sea , home of the rich and the famous including the official residence of the Dutch royal family
#Text=— mostly a rural area filled with greenhouses
#Text=— Snow World , Dutch Water Dreams , Mormon Temple ; a planned city with lots of modern architecture
#Text=By plane
#Text=Rotterdam The Hague Airport
#Text=( RTM ) is the only airport in the region .

#Text=As Amsterdam Airport Schiphol which is about north of The Hague receive many more flights , it is the vastly preferable option for many conceivable itineraries even if you final destination is inside this region .
#Text=From Amsterdam and Schiphol
#Text=there are frequent train services to The Hague , Delft and Rotterdam as well as to a few destinations in between like Schiedam .
#Text=Most of these services are Intercity trains .
#Text=Railway station Den Haag Centraal
#Text=( the Hague )
#Text=is also connected by so called Sprinters , more little trains who call at every station ( and so are slower ) .
#Text=Fastest to Rotterdam ( Central Station ) is Intercity Direct or Thalys .
#Text=Intercity Direct is more attractive as in general this train is cheaper and travelers do not have to make a reservation .
#Text=A supplement is required for the line from Schiphol to Rotterdam .
#Text=Rotterdam The Hague Airport
#Text=is connected by a bus service to Rotterdam city which also forms a link to the Rotterdam-Den Haag metro line E.
#Text=By train
#Text=MRDH has a fast connection with Paris , Lille , Brussels and Antwerp by high-speed train Thalys which calls at Rotterdam Centraal .
#Text=A slower but often much cheaper option from Antwerp and Brussels is the so called Intercity Brussels , see NMBS , which also stops at Mechelen .
#Text=This train calls at Rotterdam and The Hague railway station Hollands Spoor .
#Text=Coming from Germany
#Text=travelers always have to make an exchange in the Netherlands .

#Text=Traveling on the German high-speed train ICE from Cologne , Düsseldorf and Oberhausen , the exchange will be in Utrecht Centraal station , and comming from direction Berlin , Hanover , Osnabrück ( with the DB-intercity ) it is advisible to exhange in station Amersfoort .
#Text=From Utrecht and Amersfoort Intercity-trains depart to The Hague ( Centraal ) and to Rotterdam .

#Text=Coming from any other city in The Netherlands there are frequent intercity-services to The Hague and Rotterdam ( many times direct or with one fast exchange ) , see for more information the general planner for all kinds of public transport in the Netherlands 9292
#Text=By ferry boat
#Text=Coming from the UK the area is also reachable by several ferry-lines .
#Text=Direct connections right to the MRDH are :
#Text=P&O Ferries
#Text=- line Kingston upon Hull - Rotterdam Europoort
#Text=Stena Line
#Text=- Harwich - Hook of Holland
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Tourists who stay a few days or more time in the area , might like to discover all of the cities , towns and landscapes by ( renting a ) bicycle .
#Text=As a part of the Netherlands , MRDH offers a whole infrastructure especially for cyclists .
#Text=Especially in city centers , it is strongly advisable to lock your bike , or go to a guarded bicycle parking stations .
#Text=Guarded bicycle parking stations
#Text=Many intercity train stations have thier own bicycle parking station .
#Text=Many time the service is not free .
#Text=In and around The Hague ( with Scheveningen ) , Delft and Zoetermeer Biesieklette offers 55 guarded Bicycle parking station .
#Text=Parking your bicycle for just a few hours up to one full day is free .
#Text=Rotterdam municipality has also some locations .
#Text=Rent a bike
#Text=Bikes can be rented by several different private compagnies .
#Text=Holland-Cycling.com provides a list of adresses in Rotterdam and The Hague .
#Text=Another list of bicycle-renting in Rotterdam you will find at Rotterdam . nl .
#Text=Rotterdam also joins oBike a new kind of bicycle-sharing system ( see also city tourist information ) .
#Text=If you have an OV-chipkaart ( see also under " By public transport " ) bicycles can be rented at many train and metro stations and other central locations by the OV-fiets system .
